title: Apple cuts jobs across sales team
summary: An Apple spokesperson told Reuters that the company is continuing to hire and the affected employees can apply for new roles.  The impacted ⁠employees include account ‌managers serving major businesses, schools and government agencies, according to Bloomberg ‍News, which had reported the news earlier in the day.  Staff who operate Apple's briefing centers for institutional ​meetings and product demonstrations for prospective customers were ‌also affected, Bloomberg said.

raw.headline: Apple cuts jobs across sales team
raw.summary: An Apple spokesperson told Reuters that the company is continuing to hire and the affected employees can apply for new roles.  The impacted ⁠employees include account ‌managers serving major businesses, schools and government agencies, according to Bloomberg ‍News, which had reported the news earlier in the day.  Staff who operate Apple's briefing centers for institutional ​meetings and product demonstrations for prospective customers were ‌also affected, Bloomberg said.

title: Apple Cuts Jobs Across Its Sales Organization in Rare Layoff
summary: The cuts extended across the sales organization — hitting some teams especially hard — though the company didn’t tell employees how many roles were involved.  The affected jobs included account managers serving major businesses, schools and government agencies, as well as the staff who operate Apple’s briefing centers for institutional meetings and product demonstrations for prospective major customers.  Apple confirmed on Monday that it’s reshuffling the division, without giving specifics.

raw.headline: Apple Cuts Jobs Across Its Sales Organization in Rare Layoff
raw.summary: The cuts extended across the sales organization — hitting some teams especially hard — though the company didn’t tell employees how many roles were involved.  The affected jobs included account managers serving major businesses, schools and government agencies, as well as the staff who operate Apple’s briefing centers for institutional meetings and product demonstrations for prospective major customers.  Apple confirmed on Monday that it’s reshuffling the division, without giving specifics.

title: The Stock Market Is Riding Its Best Day Since May as Big Tech Shines
summary: A buying frenzy in Big Tech on Monday sent the Nasdaq Composite surging toward its best day since May.  The tech-heavy index was up 2.7%, which would be its largest daily gain since May 12, according to Dow Jones Market Data.  The Dow, up nearly 300 points, or 0.6%, had stronger showings earlier this month.

title: Alphabet races toward $4 trillion valuation as AI-fueled gains accelerate
summary: (Reuters) -Alphabet closed in on a $4 trillion valuation on Monday, set to become only the fourth company to enter the exclusive club,​ as the Google parent rides an artificial intelligence-driven rally.  Shares of the company rose more ‌than 5% to hit a record high of $315.9, giving it a market capitalization of $3.82 trillion.  The stock ‌has climbed nearly 70% so far this year, far outperforming AI rivals Microsoft and Amazon.com.

raw.headline: Alphabet races toward $4 trillion valuation as AI-fueled gains accelerate
raw.summary: (Reuters) -Alphabet closed in on a $4 trillion valuation on Monday, set to become only the fourth company to enter the exclusive club,​ as the Google parent rides an artificial intelligence-driven rally.  Shares of the company rose more ‌than 5% to hit a record high of $315.9, giving it a market capitalization of $3.82 trillion.  The stock ‌has climbed nearly 70% so far this year, far outperforming AI rivals Microsoft and Amazon.com.

title: Lilly’s Sharp Rally Brings Market Cap to $1 Trillion
summary: Eli Lilly (LLY) became the 10th U.S. company to reach the $1 trillion market cap milestone on Friday, following nine others that mostly come from technology. The Indianapolis-based drugmaker, the first pharmaceutical company to hit the 13-digit mark, rode a wave behind the booming market for weight-loss drugs.
